alert.note: Alert for Tallapoosa (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 30 at 12:49PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Tallapoosa County through 115 PM CDT... At 1249 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Wind Creek State Park, or near Alexander City, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Alexander City, Dadeville, Camp Hill, Jacksons` Gap, Eastern Lake Martin, Western Lake Martin, Northern Lake Martin, Wind Creek State Park, Still Waters Resort, Southern Lake Martin, Susannah Crossing, Maxwell Gunter Recreation Area, Blue Creek Marina and Dare Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
